meanings.definition: To love more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outloved her sister by always helping her with homework.
meanings.sent2: He outloved his dog by taking it for long walks every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat outloved the dog by sharing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The sun outloved the moon, shining brightly even during the night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher outloved her students, always encouraging them to do their best.

meanings.definition: To have more love for someone than they have for you.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, he always felt outloved by his crush.
meanings.sent2: She realized she outloved her friend when she remembered their shared memories.
meanings.sent3: The puppy outloved its owner by wagging its tail non-stop.
meanings.sent4: The flower outloved the bee, offering its sweet nectar generously.
meanings.sent5: The child outloved the parent, always showering them with hugs and kisses.
